reviews.review_msg: One of my favorite professors. He really cares about his students, is a great teacher and is also pretty funny. He teaches hard classes so you need to put the effort in but as long as you follow the learning objects and his advice youll get a good grade
Sort of unorganized, but then again the material is kind of tough to understand.  Funny guy.
Problem sets will make you want to tear your eyeballs out.
He is very helpful and he is the best professor at SFU.

A very smart professor assuming that the entire class is just as smart and has had previous knowledge in physical chem. Need to rely on his notes to study for the exams but his handwriting is extremely difficult to read.Assignments are hard but the exams are  fairer. He is super helpful and approachable provided that you actually UNDERSTAND him :P
The assignments for this course are difficult, but he made the midterms and finals easier so it wasn't too bad overall. Very nice to students though and he is a very approachable professor.
